instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns off after 8 second
threads.message:
Hi all,

interesting one here,
board looks perfect, no liqued damage and seems the board has never been removed.

green/orange light
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.61V stable
after you plug in charger
fan spin, image on screen, backlight turns on.
i can even sometimes do a ASD test. (wont finish) turns off premature.

after it turns off i get
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 0.0000volt.
but at <CAPACITOR>C8310</CAPACITOR> i get 0.054volt

oke over to face detection.

nothing.........

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns off after 8 second
threads.message: Bad power button? Disconnect keyboard and measure SMC ONOFF

Same issue keyboard removed.
Did not observe shutting down wil do that
did check iT after iT was turned down and iT was stil 3.3

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns off after 8 second
threads.message:
with keyboard, (rest is unpluged)

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.422 volt stable wont go off when machine turns off.
however i pluged in the mouse and when the machine turns off the mouse light also turns off and when pluging in again no mouse light..


no keyboard (SAME RESULT)

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.422 volt stable wont go off when machine turns off.
however i pluged in the mouse and when the machine turns off the mouse light also turns off and when pluging in again no mouse light..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns off after 8 second
threads.message: Could be anything. Inspect closely for liquid damage. There is really no way that is worthwhile to figure out the shut down cause if there is no liquid or some history that would point to something.
